channel.title: Articles by Marvin Kaufman on Tech Terminologies
channel.description: Recent content in Articles by Marvin Kaufman on Tech Terminologies

item.title: What is a MAC-based VLAN (Virtual Local Area Network)?
item.description: A MAC-based VLAN is a type of virtual LAN (VLAN) that is created based on the MAC addresses of network devices.

item.title: What is a Compressed File?
item.description: A compressed file is a type of data file that has had its size reduced through a process known as data compression.

item.title: What is Cloud Security Control?
item.description: Cloud security controls refer to the measures that organizations put in place to ensure the security and integrity of their data and systems when using cloud computing services.

item.title: What is a Malicious Software?
item.description: Malicious software, also known as malware, is a type of software that is specifically designed to cause harm to a computer system.

item.title: What is a Malware?
item.description: Malware is a term used to describe any software that is specifically designed to harm or exploit a computer system.

item.title: What is a Portable Software?
item.description: Portable software, also known as a portable application or a portable app, is a type of software that is designed to be easily transferred from one device to another and run without the need for installation.

item.title: What is x86?
item.description: x86 is a term that refers to a family of microprocessors that are used in a wide range of devices, including personal computers, servers, and embedded systems.

item.title: What is EXIF (Exchangeable Image File Format)?
item.description: EXIF, or Exchangeable Image File Format, is a type of metadata that is embedded in a digital image file.

item.title: What is a Page Layout?
item.description: Page layout refers to the organization and formatting of elements on a page, such as text, images, and other media, in a way that is aesthetically pleasing and consistent.

item.title: What is a Raster File Format (Raster Images)?
item.description: A raster format is a type of digital image file that is made up of tiny pixels, or “picture elements,” arranged in a grid pattern.

item.title: What is a Web-Based Installer?
item.description: A web-based installer is a software installation package that is delivered and executed over the internet.

item.title: What is DirectX?
item.description: DirectX is a collection of APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) that are used to create and handle multimedia tasks such as rendering graphics, playing audio, and handling input in Windows operating systems.

item.title: What is an Algorithm?
item.description: An algorithm is a set of instructions or a step-by-step process that is followed to solve a problem or accomplish a task.

item.title: What is a Favicon?
item.description: A favicon, also known as a favicon.ico, is a small icon that appears in the browser tab or address bar of a web browser.

item.title: What is Adware?
item.description: Adware, short for “advertising-supported software,” is a type of software that displays advertisements on a computer or mobile device.

item.title: What is a TCP Wrapper?
item.description: A “wrapper” is a layer of software that provides an additional layer of abstraction between two different systems or protocols.

item.title: What is IT Healthcare?
item.description: Information technology (IT) in healthcare refers to the use of computers, software, and other digital tools to manage and process information in the healthcare industry.

item.title: What is the Web?
item.description: The World Wide Web, commonly referred to as the “Web,” is a vast network of interconnected documents and other resources linked by hyperlinks and URLs.

item.title: What is a Master Reset?
item.description: A master reset, also known as a factory reset or hard reset, is the process of resetting a device to its original factory settings, effectively wiping all data, and returning it to the state it was in when it was initially acquired.

item.title: What is a Hard Reset?
item.description: A hard reset, also known as a factory reset or master reset, is the process of restoring a device to its original manufacturer settings.

item.title: What is DevOps?
item.description: DevOps is a software development and delivery approach that aims to bridge the gap between development and operations.

item.title: What is APU (Analytics Processing Unit)?
item.description: An Analytics Processing Unit (APU) is a type of microprocessor that is specifically designed to handle data analytics tasks efficiently.

item.title: What is a SCSI Host Adapter?
item.description: A SCSI (Small Computer System Interface) host adapter is a device that connects to a computer and allows it to communicate with SCSI devices, such as hard drives, tape drives, and scanners.

item.title: What is an Adapter?
item.description: An adapter is a device that allows two different systems or devices to connect and work together.

item.title: What is Active-Matrix?
item.description: Active-matrix is a type of display technology that is used in many electronic devices, such as laptops, smartphones, and televisions.

item.title: What is Flaming?
item.description: Flaming is the act of posting or sending offensive messages or statements with the intention of insulting or causing distress to the recipient.
